function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Calibrated activity count (a) may not accurately represent the actual number of people frequenting a street segment.","Impact":"Misrepresentation of activity count could lead to inaccurate assessment of disease spread and ineffective mitigation measures.","Mitigation":"Conduct regular surveys or use multiple data sources to validate and update calibrated activity counts.","Technologies":"Data analytics tools, remote sensing technologies, and AI-based activity monitoring systems.","People":"Public health officials, urban planners, and researchers studying disease propagation.","Owner":"Public health authorities, local municipalities, transportation agencies."},{"Description":"Anonymized mobility data may compromise individual privacy and data security.","Impact":"Potential privacy breaches and data misuse, leading to public distrust and legal issues.","Mitigation":"Implement strict data anonymization protocols and secure data transmission practices. Obtain informed consent for data collection and use.","Technologies":"Data encryption, differential privacy algorithms, secure data transfer protocols.","People":"Data privacy advocates, legal experts, and government regulatory bodies.","Owner":"Data collection and analysis organizations, government agencies, and research institutions."},{"Description":"Use of Google search query data as proxy indicators may not fully capture outdoor recreational intention.","Impact":"Inaccurate assessment of outdoor recreational activity, leading to flawed analysis and decision-making.","Mitigation":"Combine search query data with other sources such as surveys, observational studies, and community feedback to validate findings.","Technologies":"Natural language processing, sentiment analysis tools, and social media monitoring platforms.","People":"Research analysts, policy makers, and organizations studying outdoor recreational trends.","Owner":"Research institutions, data analysis organizations, and government agencies."}]}
